swingtree

Class JScrollPanels

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JScrollPane
            • swingtree.JScrollPanels
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.ScrollPaneConstants

    public class JScrollPanels
extends javax.swing.JScrollPane
    The JScrollPanels class is a container for a list of scrollable UI components. It exists to compensate for the deficits of the JList and JTable components, which are not able to receive user events like for example button clicks etc...
    Instances of this class manage ViewableEntry implementations which will be called dynamically to update the UI.
    A JScrollPanels instance can arrange its entries in a vertical or horizontal manner based on the UI.Align parameter.
    Here a simple example demonstrating the usage of the JScrollPanels class through the Swing-Tree API: 
    
 		UI.scrollPanels()
 		.add(viewModel.entries())
    ...where entries() is a method returning a Vars instance which contains a list of ViewableEntry implementations. Each ViewableEntry implementation is itself a view model responsible for supplying a UI which fits a certain context.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • of

        public static JScrollPanels of(UI.Align align,
                               java.awt.Dimension size)
        Constructs a new JScrollPanels instance with the provided alignment and size.
        Parameters:
        align - The alignment of the entries inside this JScrollPanels instance. The alignment can be either UI.Align.HORIZONTAL or UI.Align.VERTICAL.
        size - The size of the entries in this JScrollPanels instance.

      • getNumberOfEntries

        public int getNumberOfEntries()
        Returns:
        The number of entries which are currently managed by this JScrollPanels.

      • addEntry

        public void addEntry(ViewableEntry entryViewModel)
        The JScrollPanels does not store components statically in the UI tree. Instead, it is a hybrid of the traditional static approach and a renderer based approach (as in the JList). The lambda passed to this method is responsible for continuously supplying a UI which fits a certain context (which defines if the entry is selected or not among other things).
        Parameters:
        entryViewModel - A provider lambda which ought to turn a context object into a fitting UI.

      • addEntry

        public void addEntry(java.lang.String constraints,
                     ViewableEntry entryViewModel)
        The JScrollPanels does not store components statically in the UI tree. Instead, it is a hybrid of the traditional static approach and a renderer based approach (as in the JList). The lambda passed to this method is responsible for continuously supplying a UI which fits a certain context (which defines if the entry is selected or not among other things).
        Parameters:
        constraints - The constraints which ought to be applied to the entry.
        entryViewModel - A provider lambda which ought to turn a context object into a fitting UI.

      • addAllEntries

        public void addAllEntries(java.lang.String constraints,
                          java.util.List<ViewableEntry> entryViewModels)
        Adds multiple entries at once to this JScrollPanels.
        Parameters:
        constraints - The constraints which ought to be applied to the entry.
        entryViewModels - A list of entry providers which ought to be added.

      • removeAllEntries

        public void removeAllEntries()
        Use this to remove all entries.

        public void removeEntryAt(int index)

      • addEntryAt

        public void addEntryAt(int index,
                       java.lang.String attr,
                       ViewableEntry entryViewModel)
        Use this to add an entry at a certain index. Note: This method will replace an existing entry at the given index.
        Parameters:
        index - The index at which the entry ought to be added.
        attr - The constraints which ought to be applied to the entry, may be null.
        entryViewModel - The entry provider which ought to be added.

      • setEntryAt

        public void setEntryAt(int index,
                       java.lang.String attr,
                       ViewableEntry entryViewModel)
        Use this to replace an entry at a certain index. Note: This method will replace an existing entry at the given index.
        Parameters:
        index - The index at which the entry ought to be added.
        attr - The constraints which ought to be applied to the entry, may be null.
        entryViewModel - The entry provider which ought to be added.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The component type which ought to be found.
        Parameters:
        type - The component type which ought to be found.
        Returns:

      • setSelectedFor

        public <T extends javax.swing.JComponent> void setSelectedFor(java.lang.Class<T> type,
                                                              java.util.function.Predicate<T> condition)
        Use this to set entries as selected based on a condition lambda (predicate).
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the entry which ought to be selected.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of the entry which ought to be selected.
        condition - The condition which ought to be met for the entry to be selected.
